ImageSet.Name: Digitized Sky Survey (Color)
ImageSet.Credits: Copyright DSS Consortium

ImageSet.Name: VLSS: VLA Low-frequency Sky Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: VLSS Cohen, A. S.; Lane, W. M.; Cotton, W. D.; Kassim, N. E.; Lazio, T. J. W.; Perley, R. A.; Condon, J. J.; Erickson, W. C.; Served From NASA Skyview

ImageSet.Name: WMAP ILC 5-Year Cosmic Microwave Background
ImageSet.Credits: Courtesy WMAP Science Team

ImageSet.Name: Planck CMB
ImageSet.Credits: Planck is a European Space Agency mission, with significant participation from NASA. NASAs Planck Project Office is based at JPL. JPL contributed mission-enabling technology for both of Plancks science instruments. European, Canadian and U.S. Planck scientists work together to analyze the Planck data.

ImageSet.Name: SFD Dust Map (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Data provided by two NASA satellites, the Infrared Astronomy Satellite (IRAS) and the Cosmic Background Explorer (COBE). Processing by David J. Schlegel, Douglas P. Finkbeiner and Marc Davis, Princeton University and University of California, Berkeley.

ImageSet.Name: IRIS: Improved Reprocessing of IRAS Survey (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (Red is IRIS100, Green IRIS60, Blue IRIS12).

ImageSet.Name: WISE All Sky (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/UCLA

ImageSet.Name: GLIMPSE 360
ImageSet.Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/Univ. of Wisconsin. The GLIMPSE 360 survey was performed using the Spitzer Space Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GLIMPSE/MIPSGAL
ImageSet.Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/Univ. of Wisconsin. The GLIMPSE survey was performed using the Spitzer Space Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GLIMPSE/MIPSGAL
ImageSet.Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/Univ. of Wisconsin. The GLIMPSE survey was performed using the Spitzer Space Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: 2Mass: Imagery (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: This publication makes use of data products from the Two Micron All Sky Survey, which is a joint project of the University of Massachusetts and the Infrared Processing and Analysis Center/California Institute of Technology, funded by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the National Science Foundation.

ImageSet.Name: 2MASS: Catalog (Synthetic, Near Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Image Jina Suh from 2MASS catalog Copyright Microsoft 2007; This publication makes use of data products from the Two Micron All Sky Survey, which is a joint project of the University of Massachusetts and the Infrared Processing and Analysis Center/California Institute of Technology, funded by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the National Science Foundation.

ImageSet.Name: Hydrogen Alpha Full Sky Map
ImageSet.Credits: Image Courtesy Douglas Finkbeiner. The full-sky H-alpha map (6' FWHM resolution) is a composite of the Virginia Tech Spectral line Survey (VTSS) in the north and the Southern H-Alpha Sky Survey Atlas (SHASSA) in the south. The Wisconsin H-Alpha Mapper (WHAM) survey provides a stable zero-point over 3/4 of the sky on a one degree scale.

ImageSet.Name: SDSS: Sloan Digital Sky Survey (Optical)
ImageSet.Credits: Copyright SDSS

ImageSet.Name: Tycho (Synthetic, Optical)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center Scientific Visualization Studio

ImageSet.Name: USNOB: US Naval Observatory B 1.0 (Synthetic, Optical)
ImageSet.Credits: Monet D.G., Levine S.E., Casian B., et al. Astron. J., 125, 984 (2003). Rendering by Jina Suh (Microsoft).

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 4 Near-UV
ImageSet.Credits: This is the Near UV band (1770-2730A) of the GALEX GR4 data release archived at MAST/STScI. TOAST-formatted mosaics were obtained using facilities of NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 4 Far-UV
ImageSet.Credits: This is the Far UV band(1350-1780A) of the GALEX GR4 data release archived at MAST/STScI. TOAST-formatted mosaics were obtained using facilities of NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX (Ultraviolet)
ImageSet.Credits: Space Telescope Science Institute. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope. The Galaxy Explorer instrument allows observations to be made in ultraviolet bands Far UV 1350-1780A and Near UV 1770-2730A. This is the GR2/3 release.

ImageSet.Name: RASS: ROSAT All Sky Survey (X-ray)
ImageSet.Credits: This is a composite of three RASS3 surveys from the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope. Red is soft band (RASS3sb), Green is broad band (RASS3bb), Blue is hard band (RASS3hb)

ImageSet.Name: Fermi LAT 8-year (gamma)
ImageSet.Credits:
Gamma-ray intensity map (photons cm^-2 s-1 sr^-1, >1 GeV) =>1000 MeV
Credit: NASA and FERMI-LAT Team.

ImageSet.Name: Big Picture (Optical)
ImageSet.Credits: George Djorgovski, IPAC/CalTech. This single continuous digital sky image is a cut through the core of the Virgo Cluster of galaxies, derived from the Palomar-Quest digital sky survey. This image contains nearly a million faint galaxies, about half a million stars in our Milky Way and about a thousand distant quasars.

ImageSet.Name: Black Sky Background
ImageSet.Credits: Public Domain

ImageSet.Name: VLSS: VLA Low-frequency Sky Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: VLSS Cohen, A. S.; Lane, W. M.; Cotton, W. D.; Kassim, N. E.; Lazio, T. J. W.; Perley, R. A.; Condon, J. J.; Erickson, W. C.; Served From NASA Skyview

ImageSet.Name: VLA FIRST: Faint Images of the Radio Sky at Twenty-centimeters
ImageSet.Credits: The FIRST project team: R.J. Becker, D.H. Helfand, R.L. White M.D. Gregg. S.A. Laurent-Muehleisen. 1994, University of California.

ImageSet.Name: NVSS: NRAO VLA Sky Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: National Radio Astronomy Observatory. The NVSS project includes J. J. Condon, W. D. Cotton, E. W. Greisen, Q. F. Yin, R. A. Perley (NRAO), and J. J. Broderick (VPI). TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: SUMSS: Sydney University Molonglo Sky Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: The SUMSS project team and 1997-2000 School of Physics, University of Sydney. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (SUMSS, Min=0.001, Max=10).

ImageSet.Name: Westerbork Northern Sky Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: WENSS Team. The WENSS project is a collaboration between the Netherlands Foundation for Research in Astronomy (NFRA/ASTRON) and the Leiden Observatory. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (WENSS, Min=0.001, Max=10), who got it from the WENSS FTP site 1999-03-18. The original data was found using the Westerbork Synthesis Radio Telescope, which is operated by NFRA/ASTRON with support from the Netherlands Foundation for Scientific Research (NWO).

ImageSet.Name: Bonn 1420 MHz Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: Max Planck Institute for Radio Astronomy, generated by Patricia Reich and Wolfgang Reich using with the Bonn Stockert 25m telescope. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (1420MHz, Min=3000, Max=35000).

ImageSet.Name: HI All-Sky Continuum Survey (Radio)
ImageSet.Credits: Max Planck Institute for Radio Astronomy, generated by Glyn Haslam using data taken at Jodrell Bank, Effelsberg and Parkes telescopes. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (408MHz, Min=10, Max=200).

ImageSet.Name: SFD Dust Map (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Data provided by two NASA satellites, the Infrared Astronomy Satellite (IRAS) and the Cosmic Background Explorer (COBE). Processing by David J. Schlegel, Douglas P. Finkbeiner and Marc Davis, Princeton University and University of California, Berkeley.

ImageSet.Name: IRIS: Improved Reprocessing of IRAS Survey (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (Red is IRIS100, Green IRIS60, Blue IRIS12).

ImageSet.Name: 2MASS: Two Micron All Sky Survey (Synthetic, Near Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Image Jina Suh from 2MASS catalog Copyright Microsoft 2007; This publication makes use of data products from the Two Micron All Sky Survey, which is a joint project of the University of Massachusetts and the Infrared Processing and Analysis Center/California Institute of Technology, funded by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the National Science Foundation.

ImageSet.Name: IRIS 12 Microns (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (IRIS12, Min=0.5, Max=1000).

ImageSet.Name: IRIS 25 Microns (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (IRIS25, Min=1, Max=2000).

ImageSet.Name: IRIS 60 Microns (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (IRIS60, Min=1, Max=2000).

ImageSet.Name: IRIS 100 Microns (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Original IRAS data: NASA/JPL IPAC, IRIS Reprocessing: Canadian Institute for Theoretical Astrophysics/Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (IRIS100, Min=4, Max=4000).

ImageSet.Name: SFD 100 Micron (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: Data provided by two NASA satellites, the Infrared Astronomy Satellite (IRAS) and the Cosmic Background Explorer (COBE). Processing by David J. Schlegel, Douglas P. Finkbeiner and Marc Davis, Princeton University and University of California, Berkeley. TOASTing of images done by NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (SFD100m, Min=5, Max=5000).

ImageSet.Name: COBE DIRBE (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: COBE Team. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (COBE, Min=10, Max=5000).

ImageSet.Name: COBE DIRBE Annual Average Map (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: COBE Team. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (COBEAAM, Min=10, Max=5000).

ImageSet.Name: COBE DIRBE Zodi-Subtracted Mission Average (Infrared)
ImageSet.Credits: COBE Team. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (COBEZSMA, Min=10, Max=5000).

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 4 Near-UV
ImageSet.Credits: This is the Near UV band (1770-2730A) of the GALEX GR4 data release archived at MAST/STScI. TOAST-formatted mosaics were obtained using facilities of NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 4 Far-UV
ImageSet.Credits: This is the Far UV band(1350-1780A) of the GALEX GR4 data release archived at MAST/STScI. TOAST-formatted mosaics were obtained using facilities of NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 2 Combined
ImageSet.Credits: Space Telescope Science Institute. The GALEX, Galaxy Explorer, instrument allows imaging and spectroscopic observations to be made in two ultraviolet bands, Far UV 1350-1780A and Near UV 1770-2730A. This is the GR2/3 release, not the most recent GR4 release. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 2 Near-UV
ImageSet.Credits: Space Telescope Science Institute. The GALEX, Galaxy Explorer, instrument allows imaging and spectroscopic observations to be made in two ultraviolet bands, Far UV 1350-1780A and Near UV 1770-2730A. This is the GR2/3 release, not the most recent GR4 release. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: GALEX 2 Far-UV
ImageSet.Credits: Space Telescope Science Institute. The GALEX, Galaxy Explorer, instrument allows imaging and spectroscopic observations to be made in two ultraviolet bands, Far UV 1350-1780A and Near UV 1770-2730A. This is the GR2/3 release, not the most recent GR4 release. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope.

ImageSet.Name: Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer
ImageSet.Credits: Data from Center for Extreme UV Astronomy, University of California at Berkeley. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope. Red is 555 Angstroms (euve555), Green 405 Angstroms, Red 83 Angstroms.

ImageSet.Name: EUVE 83 : Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer 83 Angstroms
ImageSet.Credits: Center for Extreme UV Astronomy, University of California at Berkeley. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (euve83, Min=1, Max=150).

ImageSet.Name: EUVE 171 : Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer 171 Angstroms
ImageSet.Credits: Center for Extreme UV Astronomy, University of California at Berkeley. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (euve171, Min=4, Max=200).

ImageSet.Name: EUVE 405 : Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer 405 Angstroms
ImageSet.Credits: Center for Extreme UV Astronomy, University of California at Berkeley. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (euve405, Min=0.7, Max=70).

ImageSet.Name: EUVE 555 : Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer 555 Angstroms
ImageSet.Credits: Center for Extreme UV Astronomy, University of California at Berkeley. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (euve555, Min=5, Max=500).

ImageSet.Name: RASS: ROSAT All Sky Survey (X-ray)
ImageSet.Credits: This is a composite of three RASS3 surveys from the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope. Red is soft band (RASS3sb), Green is broad band (RASS3bb), Blue is hard band (RASS3hb)

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT Hard Band Count Map (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: We have made use of the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (RASS3hb, Min=0.2, Max=50).

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT Soft Band Count Map (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: We have made use of the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (RASS3sb, Min=0.2, Max=50).

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT Broad Band Count Map (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: We have made use of the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (RASS3bb, Min=0.2, Max=50).

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT Soft Band Intensity (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: We have made use of the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (RASSSB, Min=0.0002, Max=10).

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT Hard Band Intensity (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: We have made use of the ROSAT Data Archive of the Max-Planck-Institut fur extraterrestrische Physik (MPE) at Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (RASSHB, Min=0.0002, Max=10).

ImageSet.Name: ROSAT PSPC summed pointed observations, 2 degree cutoff, intensity (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: Observational data from NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, mosaicking and TOASTing of images done by NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (PSPC2int, Min=0.00002, Max=0.01).

ImageSet.Name: Swift BAT All-Sky Survey: Significance 14-195 keV (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA BAT Team. TOASTing of images done by NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (BATSig, Min=1, Max=10).

ImageSet.Name: Swift BAT All-Sky Survey: Flux 14-195 keV (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA BAT Team. TOASTing of images done by NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (BATFlux, Min=1e-5, Max=1e-3).

ImageSet.Name: GRANAT/SIGMA Significance (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: Original data: High Energy Astrophysics Department, Space Research Institute, Moscow, Russia; CEA, Centre d'Etudes de Saclay Orme des Merisiers, France; Centre d'Etude Spatiale des Rayonnements, Toulouse, France; Federation de Recherche Astroparticule et Cosmologie Universite de Paris, France. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (GRANAT_SIGMA_sig, Min=0.5, Max=50).

ImageSet.Name: GRANAT/SIGMA Flux (X-Ray)
ImageSet.Credits: Original data: High Energy Astrophysics Department, Space Research Institute, Moscow, Russia; CEA, Centre d'Etudes de Saclay Orme des Merisiers, France; Centre d'Etude Spatiale des Rayonnements, Toulouse, France; Federation de Recherche Astroparticule et Cosmologie Universite de Paris, France. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (GRANAT_SIGMA_flux, Min=1e-5, Max=0.01).

ImageSet.Name: Fermi (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA and the FERMI-LAT Team. Survey announced 26 AUgust 2008.

ImageSet.Name: Fermi Six Months (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA and the FERMI-LAT Team. Survey announced 26 AUgust 2008.

ImageSet.Name: Fermi Year Two (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA and the FERMI-LAT Team.

ImageSet.Name: Fermi Year Three (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: NASA and the FERMI-LAT Team.

ImageSet.Name: CGRO Compton Telescope: 3 channel data (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: CompTel Instrument Team. Maps generated by Andrew Strong, Max-Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics, Garching, Germany. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (comptel, Min=0.00005, Max=0.1).

ImageSet.Name: EGRET Soft (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: EGRET Instrument team, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (EGRETsoft, Min=0.0001, Max=0.002).

ImageSet.Name: EGRET Hard (Gamma)
ImageSet.Credits: EGRET Instrument team, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. TOAST-formatted data was obtained from NASA's SkyView Virtual Telescope (EGREThard, Min=0.00002, Max=0.005).
